meanings.definition: To watch or observe an event or activity as a spectator.
meanings.sent1: I spectated the soccer game from the stands.
meanings.sent2: She spectated the concert from the front row.
meanings.sent3: The cat spectated the birds chirping outside the window.
meanings.sent4: The moon spectated the Earth's beauty from afar.
meanings.sent5: The child spectated the magic show with wide eyes.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I spectated the marathon in town.
meanings.sent2: They spectated the play last weekend.
meanings.sent3: The dog spectated the squirrel running up the tree.
meanings.sent4: The old tree spectated the changes in the forest over the years.
meanings.sent5: The student spectated the science experiment with curiosity.
